TypeSignature.Value: .class public auto ansi beforefieldinit Title extends System.Web.UI.DataVisualization.Charting.ChartNamedElement implements class System.IDisposable, class System.Web.UI.DataVisualization.Charting.IChartMapArea

Docs.summary: Represents a title for the entire chart image.

remarks.format:
## Remarks The <xref:System.Web.UI.DataVisualization.Charting.Title> class encapsulates all the functionality of a title for the <xref:System.Web.UI.DataVisualization.Charting.Chart> control. This class is exposed using the <xref:System.Web.UI.DataVisualization.Charting.Chart.Titles%2A> collection property of the root <xref:System.Web.UI.DataVisualization.Charting.Chart> object.
There can be any number of titles for an entire chart image.
Titles are able to:
- Be docked and aligned or custom-positioned.
- Be displayed inside or outside the plotted chart areas.
- Use a predefined <xref:System.Web.UI.DataVisualization.Charting.TextStyle> such as <xref:System.Web.UI.DataVisualization.Charting.TextStyle.Embed> or <xref:System.Web.UI.DataVisualization.Charting.TextStyle.Shadow>.
- Use hatching, gradient colors and background images.
- Be sized and positioned anywhere within the chart image.

MemberSignature.Value: .method public hidebysig specialname rtspecialname instance void .ctor() cil managed

Docs.summary: Initializes a new instance of the class.

A enumeration value that determines where the title will be docked on the chart.
The font used to draw the title.
The color used to draw the title.
Docs.summary: Initializes a new instance of the class with the specified title text, docking value, font and color.
Gets or sets the alignment of the title.
Docs.value: A enumeration value that represents the title alignment within the text drawing area. The default value is .

remarks.format: ## Remarks The <xref:System.Web.UI.DataVisualization.Charting.Title.Alignment%2A> property has no effect on alignment if the <xref:System.Web.UI.DataVisualization.Charting.Title.Position%2A> property is not set to <xref:System.Web.UI.DataVisualization.Charting.ElementPosition.Auto%2A>.

Attribute.AttributeName: System.ComponentModel.Editor("System.Web.UI.Design.DataVisualization.Charting.ChartColorEditor, System.Web.DataVisualization.Design, Version=4.0.0.0, Culture=neutral, PublicKeyToken=31bf3856ad364e35", "System.Drawing.Design.UITypeEditor, System.Drawing, Version=4.0.0.0, Culture=neutral, PublicKeyToken=b03f5f7f11d50a3a")

Docs.summary: Gets or sets the background color of the title.
Docs.value: A value that represents the background color of the title. The default color is .

remarks.format:
## Remarks You can set this property to any valid ARGB (alpha, red, green, blue) value.
The <xref:System.Web.UI.DataVisualization.Charting.Title.BackColor%2A> value will be the first color used if you have specified gradient colors for the background.
The alpha value controls the opacity of a color. If you set this color to "transparent"—that is, if you use an alpha value of 0—no color will be assigned to the background of the title. As a result, the background will be transparent.

Attribute.AttributeName: System.ComponentModel.Editor("System.Web.UI.Design.DataVisualization.Charting.GradientEditor, System.Web.DataVisualization.Design, Version=4.0.0.0, Culture=neutral, PublicKeyToken=31bf3856ad364e35", "System.Drawing.Design.UITypeEditor, System.Drawing, Version=4.0.0.0, Culture=neutral, PublicKeyToken=b03f5f7f11d50a3a")

Docs.summary: Gets or sets the orientation for the background gradient of a title. Also determines whether a gradient is used.
Docs.value: A enumeration that represents the orientation for the background gradient of a title. The default value is .

remarks.format:
## Remarks Use the <xref:System.Web.UI.DataVisualization.Charting.Title.BackGradientStyle%2A> property to determine whether a title will display a gradient, and to determine the orientation of the gradient if one is used.
For a listing of available patterns, refer to the <xref:System.Web.UI.DataVisualization.Charting.GradientStyle> enumeration.
To use gradient colors:
Set the primary color of the title background with the <xref:System.Web.UI.DataVisualization.Charting.Title.BackColor%2A> property.
Set the secondary color of the title background with the <xref:System.Web.UI.DataVisualization.Charting.Title.BackSecondaryColor%2A> property.
Set this <xref:System.Web.UI.DataVisualization.Charting.Title.BackGradientStyle%2A> property to the desired gradient style.

Attribute.AttributeName: System.ComponentModel.Editor("System.Web.UI.Design.DataVisualization.Charting.HatchStyleEditor, System.Web.DataVisualization.Design, Version=4.0.0.0, Culture=neutral, PublicKeyToken=31bf3856ad364e35", "System.Drawing.Design.UITypeEditor, System.Drawing, Version=4.0.0.0, Culture=neutral, PublicKeyToken=b03f5f7f11d50a3a")

Docs.summary: Gets or sets the hatching style for the title.
Docs.value: A enumeration that represents the hatching style for the title. The default value is .

remarks.format:
## Remarks The <xref:System.Web.UI.DataVisualization.Charting.ChartHatchStyle> enumeration specifies the hatch pattern used by a brush of type <xref:System.Drawing.Drawing2D.HatchBrush>. The hatch pattern consists of a solid background color and lines drawn over the background.
For a listing of available hatching styles, refer to the <xref:System.Web.UI.DataVisualization.Charting.ChartHatchStyle> enumeration.
**Note** The color of hatching lines is determined by the <xref:System.Web.UI.DataVisualization.Charting.Title.BackSecondaryColor%2A> property.

Attribute.AttributeName: System.ComponentModel.Editor("System.Web.UI.Design.DataVisualization.Charting.ImageValueEditor, System.Web.DataVisualization.Design, Version=4.0.0.0, Culture=neutral, PublicKeyToken=31bf3856ad364e35", "System.Drawing.Design.UITypeEditor, System.Drawing, Version=4.0.0.0, Culture=neutral, PublicKeyToken=b03f5f7f11d50a3a")

Docs.summary: Gets or sets the background image of the title.
Docs.value: A value that represents the URL of an image file. The default is an empty string.

remarks.format:
## Remarks This property defines a path to a background image for a <xref:System.Web.UI.DataVisualization.Charting.Chart> title, and can be an absolute or relative URL.
To position the image, use the <xref:System.Web.UI.DataVisualization.Charting.Title.BackImageAlignment%2A> and <xref:System.Web.UI.DataVisualization.Charting.Title.BackImageWrapMode%2A> properties.
You can also specify one of the colors displayed by the image as "transparent", by setting the <xref:System.Web.UI.DataVisualization.Charting.Title.BackImageTransparentColor%2A> property.
An image be any valid graphics file supported by .NET Framework, including icons.
Background images take precedence over other background properties such as gradient color.

Docs.summary: Gets or sets the alignment of the title background image.
Docs.value: A enumeration value that represents the alignment of the title background image. The default value is .

remarks.format: ## Remarks This property is used when the <xref:System.Web.UI.DataVisualization.Charting.Title.BackImageWrapMode%2A> property is set to <xref:System.Web.UI.DataVisualization.Charting.ChartImageWrapMode.Unscaled>.

Attribute.AttributeName: System.ComponentModel.Editor("System.Web.UI.Design.DataVisualization.Charting.ChartColorEditor, System.Web.DataVisualization.Design, Version=4.0.0.0, Culture=neutral, PublicKeyToken=31bf3856ad364e35", "System.Drawing.Design.UITypeEditor, System.Drawing, Version=4.0.0.0, Culture=neutral, PublicKeyToken=b03f5f7f11d50a3a")

Docs.summary: Gets or sets a color that will be drawn as transparent when the background image is drawn.
Docs.value: A value that will be drawn as transparent when the background image is drawn. The default value is .

remarks.format: ## Remarks This color will be displayed as transparent when the chart is rendered.

Docs.summary: Gets or sets the drawing mode for the background image of the title.
Docs.value: A enumeration value that represents the drawing mode for the background image of the title. The default value is .

remarks.format:
## Remarks The <xref:System.Web.UI.DataVisualization.Charting.Title.BackImageWrapMode%2A> property determines how the image is displayed; the image can be tiled, scaled, and so forth.
If an image is scaled, it will be stretched to fit within the bounds of the title. If the image is tiled, it is repeatedly drawn, starting from the top-left corner of the title.
For more information about the available wrapping modes, see the <xref:System.Web.UI.DataVisualization.Charting.ChartImageWrapMode> enumeration topic.
If the <xref:System.Web.UI.DataVisualization.Charting.Title.BackImageWrapMode%2A> property is set to <xref:System.Web.UI.DataVisualization.Charting.ChartImageWrapMode.Unscaled>, the location where the image is drawn is determined by the <xref:System.Web.UI.DataVisualization.Charting.Title.BackImageAlignment%2A> property setting.

Attribute.AttributeName: System.ComponentModel.Editor("System.Web.UI.Design.DataVisualization.Charting.ChartColorEditor, System.Web.DataVisualization.Design, Version=4.0.0.0, Culture=neutral, PublicKeyToken=31bf3856ad364e35", "System.Drawing.Design.UITypeEditor, System.Drawing, Version=4.0.0.0, Culture=neutral, PublicKeyToken=b03f5f7f11d50a3a")

Docs.summary: Gets or sets the secondary color of the title background.
Docs.value: A value used for the secondary color of a background with hatching or gradient fill. The default value is .

remarks.format:
## Remarks This <xref:System.Web.UI.DataVisualization.Charting.Title.BackSecondaryColor%2A> property is one of several related properties that determine the secondary background color of <xref:System.Web.UI.DataVisualization.Charting.Chart> objects, and is used when gradient colors are being applied.
You can set <xref:System.Web.UI.DataVisualization.Charting.Title.BackSecondaryColor%2A> to any valid ARGB (alpha, red, green, blue) value.
If hatching is used, the <xref:System.Web.UI.DataVisualization.Charting.Title.BackSecondaryColor%2A> property determines the color of the hatching lines for the title.
To use gradient colors for the background of a title:
- Set the primary color with the <xref:System.Web.UI.DataVisualization.Charting.Title.BackColor%2A> property.
- Set the secondary color with the <xref:System.Web.UI.DataVisualization.Charting.Title.BackSecondaryColor%2A> property.
- Set the <xref:System.Web.UI.DataVisualization.Charting.Title.BackGradientStyle%2A> property to the desired gradient style.

Attribute.AttributeName: System.ComponentModel.Editor("System.Web.UI.Design.DataVisualization.Charting.ChartColorEditor, System.Web.DataVisualization.Design, Version=4.0.0.0, Culture=neutral, PublicKeyToken=31bf3856ad364e35", "System.Drawing.Design.UITypeEditor, System.Drawing, Version=4.0.0.0, Culture=neutral, PublicKeyToken=b03f5f7f11d50a3a")

Docs.summary: Gets or sets the border color of the title.
Docs.value: A value used to draw the border color of the title. The default color is .

remarks.format: ## Remarks You can set the <xref:System.Web.UI.DataVisualization.Charting.Title.BorderColor%2A> property to any valid ARGB (alpha, red, green, blue) value.

Docs.summary: Gets or sets the border style of the title.
Docs.value: A enumeration value that determines the border style of the title.

remarks.format:
## Remarks The <xref:System.Web.UI.DataVisualization.Charting.Title.BorderDashStyle%2A> property determines the line style to use for a border. The line can be solid, dotted, and so forth.
For other border styles, see the <xref:System.Web.UI.DataVisualization.Charting.ChartDashStyle> enumeration topic.

Docs.summary: Gets or sets the border width of the title.
Docs.value: An value that determines the border width, in pixels, of the title.

MemberSignature.Value: .method familyhidebysig virtual instance void Dispose(bool disposing) cil managed

Docs.param: to release both managed and unmanaged resources; to release only unmanaged resources.
Docs.summary: Releases the unmanaged resources used by the and optionally releases the managed resources.
Gets or sets the name of the where the title will be docked.
Docs.value: A value that represents the name of the where this title will be docked. The default value is the empty string.

Docs.summary: Gets or sets a value that determines where the title is docked.
Docs.value: A enumeration value that specifies the docking location of the title. The default value is .

remarks.format:
## Remarks The <xref:System.Web.UI.DataVisualization.Charting.Title> can be docked to the top, left, bottom or right of either the entire chart image, or the inside or outside of a chart area. If the <xref:System.Web.UI.DataVisualization.Charting.Title.IsDockedInsideChartArea%2A> property is set to `false`, docking applies to the entire chart image. If the <xref:System.Web.UI.DataVisualization.Charting.Title.IsDockedInsideChartArea%2A> property is set to `true`, docking applies to the <xref:System.Web.UI.DataVisualization.Charting.ChartArea> object specified by the <xref:System.Web.UI.DataVisualization.Charting.Title.DockedToChartArea%2A> property
This property has no effect if the <xref:System.Web.UI.DataVisualization.Charting.Title.Position%2A> property is not set to <xref:System.Web.UI.DataVisualization.Charting.ElementPosition.Auto%2A>.

Docs.summary: Gets or sets the positive or negative offset of the docked title position.
Docs.value: An value that represents an offset of the docked title position.

Docs.summary: Gets or sets the font for the title.
Docs.value: A object that specifies the font for the title. Defaults to "Microsoft Sans Serif, 8pt".

remarks.format: ## Remarks Use a new <xref:System.Drawing.Font> object when setting this property. Assign the entire object to the property.

Attribute.AttributeName: System.ComponentModel.Editor("System.Web.UI.Design.DataVisualization.Charting.ChartColorEditor, System.Web.DataVisualization.Design, Version=4.0.0.0, Culture=neutral, PublicKeyToken=31bf3856ad364e35", "System.Drawing.Design.UITypeEditor, System.Drawing, Version=4.0.0.0, Culture=neutral, PublicKeyToken=b03f5f7f11d50a3a")

Docs.summary: Gets or sets the color of the title text.
Docs.value: A value that specifies the color of the title text.

remarks.format: ## Remarks The <xref:System.Web.UI.DataVisualization.Charting.Title.ForeColor%2A> property is used to set the title text color.

Docs.summary: Gets or sets a flag that specifies whether the title should be docked within a object.
Docs.value: if the title will be docked within a chart area; if the title will be docked outside the chart area. The default value is .

remarks.format:
## Remarks If the <xref:System.Web.UI.DataVisualization.Charting.Title.IsDockedInsideChartArea%2A> property is set to `false`, the title is docked to the outside edge of the plotted chart areas; if this property is set to `true`, the title will be docked to the inside edge of the chart area. This property will have no effect if the name of a <xref:System.Web.UI.DataVisualization.Charting.ChartArea> object is not assigned to the <xref:System.Web.UI.DataVisualization.Charting.Title.DockedToChartArea%2A> property.
**Note** This behavior only applies if the <xref:System.Web.UI.DataVisualization.Charting.Title.Position%2A> property is set to <xref:System.Web.UI.DataVisualization.Charting.ElementPosition.Auto%2A>. If this is not the case, setting the <xref:System.Web.UI.DataVisualization.Charting.Title.IsDockedInsideChartArea%2A> property has no effect, because the position of the title is then determined by the <xref:System.Web.UI.DataVisualization.Charting.Title.Position%2A> property value.

Docs.summary: Gets or sets the map area attributes of the title.
Docs.value: A value that represents the map area attributes of the title. The default is a zero-length string.

remarks.format:
## Remarks If you set the <xref:System.Web.UI.DataVisualization.Charting.Title.MapAreaAttributes%2A> property, a client-side image map will automatically be created. A map area will also be created, with its attribute string appended to the \<MAP> tag that corresponds to the chart object for which this property is being set.
Because the entire attribute string is appended to the \<MAP> tag, multiple attributes should be separated with a space.
The <xref:System.Web.UI.DataVisualization.Charting.Title.MapAreaAttributes%2A> property can be used in conjunction with the <xref:System.Web.UI.DataVisualization.Charting.Title.Url%2A> property to specify map area attributes, for example, Target= _Blank, as well as client-side event handlers, for example, OnClick="MyEvent()".
Setting this property will have no effect if the <xref:System.Web.UI.DataVisualization.Charting.Chart.IsMapEnabled%2A> property is set to `false`. Its default value is `true`.
**Important** To create an image map in this manner, the <xref:System.Web.UI.DataVisualization.Charting.Chart.RenderType%2A> property of the <xref:System.Web.UI.DataVisualization.Charting.Chart> object must be set to <xref:System.Web.UI.DataVisualization.Charting.RenderType.ImageTag>. It is possible to create an image map when using binary streaming, but another technique must be used.
Special keywords may be used when setting this property; each keyword will be replaced with some type of data from the applicable chart element. Refer to the following table for a listing of all available keywords:
|Keyword|Replaced by| |-------------|-----------------| |#VALX|X-value of the data point.| |#VAL, #VALY, #VALY2, #VALY3…|Y-values of the data point.| |#SER|Series name.| |#LABEL|Data point label.| |#INDEX|Data point index.| |#PERCENT|Percentage of the data point Y-value.| |#TOTAL|Total of all Y-values in the series.| |#LEGENDTEXT|Legend text.|
To create image maps that have user-defined coordinates, use the <xref:System.Web.UI.DataVisualization.Charting.Chart.MapAreas%2A> property of the root <xref:System.Web.UI.DataVisualization.Charting.Chart>object.

MemberSignature.Value: public override string Name { get; set; }

Docs.summary: Gets or sets the unique name of a object.
Docs.value: A value that represents the unique name of the title object.

remarks.format:
## Remarks The name of a title object must be unique; otherwise an exception will be thrown.
This property can be used as the indexer when you retrieve a <xref:System.Web.UI.DataVisualization.Charting.Title> object from the <xref:System.Web.UI.DataVisualization.Charting.TitleCollection> object.
If this property is set to a zero-length string, an exception will be thrown.

Docs.summary: Gets or sets an object, which can be used to get or set the position of the title.
Docs.value: An value that represents the position of the title. The default value is .

remarks.format:
## Remarks If the <xref:System.Web.UI.DataVisualization.Charting.Title.Position%2A> property is automatic (that is, Title.Position.Auto = `true`) the title position is calculated automatically by the <xref:System.Web.UI.DataVisualization.Charting.Chart> control, taking into account the <xref:System.Web.UI.DataVisualization.Charting.Title.Docking%2A>, <xref:System.Web.UI.DataVisualization.Charting.Title.Alignment%2A> and <xref:System.Web.UI.DataVisualization.Charting.Title.IsDockedInsideChartArea%2A> property settings.
If it is not automatic, the <xref:System.Web.UI.DataVisualization.Charting.Title.Docking%2A>, <xref:System.Web.UI.DataVisualization.Charting.Title.DockedToChartArea%2A> and <xref:System.Web.UI.DataVisualization.Charting.Title.IsDockedInsideChartArea%2A> properties are ignored, and the title position is solely determined by the value of the returned <xref:System.Web.UI.DataVisualization.Charting.ElementPosition> object.

Docs.summary: Gets or sets the postback value that can be processed on a event.
Docs.value: A value that represents the value that is passed to a event.

Attribute.AttributeName: System.ComponentModel.Editor("System.Web.UI.Design.DataVisualization.Charting.ChartColorEditor, System.Web.DataVisualization.Design, Version=4.0.0.0, Culture=neutral, PublicKeyToken=31bf3856ad364e35", "System.Drawing.Design.UITypeEditor, System.Drawing, Version=4.0.0.0, Culture=neutral, PublicKeyToken=b03f5f7f11d50a3a")

Docs.summary: Gets or sets the shadow color for the title.
Docs.value: A value for the title. The default color is .

remarks.format:
## Remarks This property can be set to any valid ARGB (alpha, red, green, blue) value.
The alpha value can be used to achieve a "realistic" shadowing effect; try a color value of "128,0,0,0" for shadows.
To implement a shadow, set the <xref:System.Web.UI.DataVisualization.Charting.Title.ShadowOffset%2A> property to a value other than zero (0).

Docs.summary: Gets or sets the shadow offset, in pixels, of the title.
Docs.value: An value that represents the shadow offset, in pixels, of the title.

remarks.format: ## Remarks To implement shadowing, set this property to a value other than zero (0). A positive value will result in a shadow that shifts down and to the right; a negative value will result in a shadow that shifts up and to the left.

Docs.summary: Gets or sets the text for the title.
Docs.value: A value that represents the text for the title.

Docs.summary: Gets or sets the orientation of the text in the title.
Docs.value: A enumeration value that specifies the orientation of the text in the title.

Docs.summary: Gets or sets the style of the text for the title.
Docs.value: A enumeration value that determines the style of the text for the title. The default value is .

remarks.format:
## Remarks There are five possible styles for title text: <xref:System.Web.UI.DataVisualization.Charting.TextStyle.Default>, <xref:System.Web.UI.DataVisualization.Charting.TextStyle.Shadow>, <xref:System.Web.UI.DataVisualization.Charting.TextStyle.Emboss>, <xref:System.Web.UI.DataVisualization.Charting.TextStyle.Embed>, and <xref:System.Web.UI.DataVisualization.Charting.TextStyle.Frame>. Refer to the table below for a summary of these styles:
|Style|Description| |-----------|-----------------| |Default|Text is displayed using the desired font and color, with no additional effects.| |Shadow|Text is displayed using the desired font and color with an added shadow effect on the text.| |Emboss|Text is displayed using the desired font and color but drawn with an embossing effect.| |Embed|Text is displayed using the desired font and color but drawn with an embedding effect.| |Frame|Text is displayed using the desired font and color but drawn as an outline of the text, that is, with no fill.|

Docs.summary: Gets or sets the tooltip for the title.
Docs.value: A value that represents the tooltip for the title.

remarks.format:
## Remarks If you set the <xref:System.Web.UI.DataVisualization.Charting.Title.ToolTip%2A> property, a client-side image map will automatically be created. A map area will also be created with its Title attribute set to the specified tooltip string. The map area will use the dimensions that correspond to the title.
Setting this property will have no effect if the <xref:System.Web.UI.DataVisualization.Charting.Chart.IsMapEnabled%2A> property is set to `false`. The default value is `true`.
**Important** To create an image map in this manner, the <xref:System.Web.UI.DataVisualization.Charting.Chart.RenderType%2A> property of the <xref:System.Web.UI.DataVisualization.Charting.Chart> object must be set to <xref:System.Web.UI.DataVisualization.Charting.RenderType.ImageTag>. It is possible to create an image map when using binary streaming, but another technique must be used.

Attribute.AttributeName: System.ComponentModel.Editor("System.Web.UI.Design.DataVisualization.Charting.UrlValueEditor, System.Web.DataVisualization.Design, Version=4.0.0.0, Culture=neutral, PublicKeyToken=31bf3856ad364e35", "System.Drawing.Design.UITypeEditor, System.Drawing, Version=4.0.0.0, Culture=neutral, PublicKeyToken=b03f5f7f11d50a3a")

Docs.summary: Gets or sets the target URL of the hyperlink for the title.
Docs.value: A value that represents the target URL of the hyperlink for the title. The default value is a zero-length string.

remarks.format:
## Remarks If you set this property, a client-side image map will be automatically created. A map area will also be created with its HREF attribute set to the specified anchor or URL.
Setting this property will have no effect if the <xref:System.Web.UI.DataVisualization.Charting.Chart.IsMapEnabled%2A> property is set to `false`. The default value is `true`.
**Important** To create an image map in this manner, the <xref:System.Web.UI.DataVisualization.Charting.Chart.RenderType%2A> property of the <xref:System.Web.UI.DataVisualization.Charting.Chart> object must be set to <xref:System.Web.UI.DataVisualization.Charting.RenderType.ImageTag>. It is possible to create an image map when using binary streaming, but another technique must be used.
Attributes of the map area(s), for example, TARGET=_Blank, can be specified by using the <xref:System.Web.UI.DataVisualization.Charting.Title.MapAreaAttributes%2A> property.
The <xref:System.Web.UI.DataVisualization.Charting.Title.Url%2A> property allows you to set special keywords to display different types of chart-related data.
To create image maps that have user-defined coordinates, use the <xref:System.Web.UI.DataVisualization.Charting.Chart.MapAreas%2A> property of the root <xref:System.Web.UI.DataVisualization.Charting.Chart>object.

MemberSignature.Value: public virtual bool Visible { get; set; }

Docs.summary: Gets or sets a value that indicates whether the title is visible.
Docs.value: if the title visible; otherwise, .

remarks.format: ## Remarks Example
